website_summaries.verdict: Kids 6 and up will have no problem learning how to use this responsive robot thanks to a very intuitive companion app.
pros: Uses Blockly drag-and-drop coding app to program moves and behaviors
High-quality, sturdy robot that holds up to frequent use
cons: Initial firmware update can be glitchy, and can only be done through a Bluetooth connection to the robot

customer_reviews.title: Robot won't update after purchase
customer_reviews.text: Robot required an update before use. Contacted with customer service, but problem was not solved. Three days after purchase, the robot could not do anything. My device is the latest model which was verified by BLE checker app as BLE compatiable. Therefore it's not BLE problem, it's the Wonder app compatibility issue which the company should develop and solve.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Great robot for a wide range of ages!
customer_reviews.text: My 5-year old daughter and my 11-year old son both enjoy Dash (and my husband and I do, too). There are many different apps you can use to control Dash in different ways. It's a wonderful introduction to robotics/programming. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Laurel Sunderman

customer_reviews.title: Probably not the best for a 4 year old although very awesome in general
customer_reviews.text: This is SO FUN!! I bought it for my 4 year old nephew who I think is super smart (but I'm not biased or anything, ha). It was a bit advanced for him to do the formula-type stuff, but I had a lot of fun! Ha! He also loved doing the one-off tricks with him, like making him move or having him dance. Surprisingly he still really loves this robot - it could be because of the way I've framed it, but I also think that as he gets older he'll love it even more.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: A head mounted sensor would enable finer control over the body mounted sensors
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to help motivate the kids to tinker. And it IS adequate for that purpose though could improve in the following ways: A head mounted sensor would enable finer control over the body mounted sensors. The Blockly language is not well featured, and could benefit from more advanced control and sensor integration; kids appreciate more freedom and power. Lego attachment points don't provide much means of accessory control. Head range of motion is the only way to move attachments independently of the body, but motion is fairly limited and set angles cannot be sustained. Some additional tweaks to software and firmware might make this much more enticing.
customer_reviews.author: davido

customer_reviews.title: Think twice before you buy
customer_reviews.text: No manual or description of components and how they work. Web links go to empty pages. Support email was rather incomplete. You will be frustrated by this product. Designed for a preschooler but as an electrical engineer with IT background this was confusing to get going. Apps add nothing to help but programming works fine until you get a syntax error with no explanation A 6 year old got frustrated so warn your kid if they see the errors.
customer_reviews.author: TONTO29

customer_reviews.title: Won't charge
customer_reviews.text: It worked for a few minutes out of the box doing a few basic things but it quickly died and we can't get it to recharge. Literally played with it for 2 minutes and now it's completely dead.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Flake

customer_reviews.title: A MUST!
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best STEM toy ever. My daughter won't stop playing with it. She is 7 and gets easily frustrated when things are too hard. The easy instruction and "hints" make this challenging enough for her to continue to want to move forward, but easy enough that she can complete the tasks on her own. Having her come show me the new "programs" she makes is so exciting for both of us.
customer_reviews.author: Jana

customer_reviews.title: Dash Robot - fun for ALL ages!
customer_reviews.text: We love this thing! I got it for my 6 year old for Christmas and got my 9 year old daughter the Lego Boost. The Dash robot is by far the favorite for them both. I had thought the Dash robot seemed geared for younger kids more than older, but there are several apps for play and each app not only has varying levels of difficulty built in, but even the open play modes are as complicated or simple as the child can make them. This is a great product and, if decided between the Dash and the Boost, I'd recommend Dash all day long.
customer_reviews.author: M. Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Amused for Hours
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these for Christmas; one for my nine-year-old son, and one for my eleven-year-old daughter. They love them, especially driving them around with their kindle and ipod, as well as coding them. Considered getting Cue for my daughter, but it did not seem as though there was much for that bot as it's newer.
customer_reviews.author: Typhany S.

customer_reviews.title: So many great things to say about this toy!
customer_reviews.text: I was going back and forth between this one or cozmo. Dash is AWESOME! The app is great and easy for my kid to use. Really teaches you step by step how to program the robot and then seeing it come to life after coding is just so rewarding for him. The remote control part of it is also fun, the cat likes to chase it around.
customer_reviews.author: Bubblegum

customer_reviews.title: Product does not work. Very disappointing for my 7 ...
customer_reviews.text: Product does not work. Very disappointing for my 7 year old grandson. I need to return the robot and ask for a replacement which will work.
customer_reviews.author: Lynne Kopp

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: This product works, when you can get it to connect.... Bought a brand new Fire 7 tab because it doesn't connect to computer blue tooth and had a difficult time connecting it to a Samsung tab pro 12.2. Before purchasing the tablet reviewed acceptable devices, it is listed (as well as tab pro 12.2). The tablet does not connect. This robot is useless without some sort of firmware update which will assist with connectivity. DO NOT BUY. MY DAUGHTER IS HEARTBROKEN.
customer_reviews.author: momoftheyear

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointed is an understatement
customer_reviews.text: Well this was the present my son waited to find under the tree. Unfortunately the start up manual wasnt in the box. You would think for almost 300 dollars that it would be there. nope. so we head online to download one... then we go to turn on dot. And theres no indication of power. Okay so maybe it just needs charged. Plug it in. No lights. No indication its charging. Use other cord. Same results. Which I will add only came with cords and no end to plug in a wall at all. Will have to send this back and get it replaced. Dot doesnt work at all and will not turn on!!! MERRY CHRISTMAS!! 😡🤬😡
customer_reviews.author: Janice

customer_reviews.title: Fun for everyone
customer_reviews.text: We love Dash. I bought one for my 9 year old a couple years ago and bought this one for my 6 year old so they can play together. And I was able to download the apps to their LeapPad Epic's, so I didn't have to worry about buying them tablets or borrowing mine. Added bonus, mom likes to play with it too, it's very fun. 😁
customer_reviews.author: MEH

customer_reviews.title: The quality is great but it’s to expensive to be a remote control
customer_reviews.text: Ok I purchased this for my grand son he’s 8 and and it’s extrememly hard to learn and operate, me and him together figured it out somewhat but it should have an instruction booklet with it bc the coding on this is very hard! The quality is great but it’s to expensive to be a remote control! So you need to have a lot of time to educate your kiddos on this!
customer_reviews.author: Sharice Perkins

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Their apps do not work with any of my devices. It was really disappointing for my daughter. It supports a very limited set of android devices and does not work on any others. I really find it hard to understand the software engineering behind this toy claiming to teach programming and robots to kids. They should put a clear warning on the limited number of devices. I hope this review helps others.
customer_reviews.author: A.E.

customer_reviews.title: Not quite what I expected for the money
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 7 year old grandson for Christmas. It comes with VERY LITTLE instructions, So is very deceiving when it says ready to use right out of the box. Ready to use out of the box simply means you can get this robot to move ahead, move left, move right etc by using the controller. For a somewhat expensive toy, there should be more instructions on the programming aspect of it. If You Tube can tell you how to do this, the instructions should. My grandson got bored real quickly when he couldn’t understand how it worked
customer_reviews.author: Satisfied customer

customer_reviews.title: My son's favorite Christmas gift by far
customer_reviews.text: We bought this because the programming interface is similar to another one that he uses at school. He recognized it immediately. So far, he is using it mostly as a remote control robot, but I'm hopeful that he'll take advantage of the programming more as he becomes comfortable with it. The robot travels over carpet with ease. It's much faster on hardwood, but is no slouch on carpeting. Amazingly Dash has no volume control which can quickly become annoying, but he has been good about limiting the noise it makes.
customer_reviews.author: Mikul

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work...
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately the robot only worked for 30 minutes. I contacted the company and they requested a video of the problem. I had to send the video twice and I still haven’t received a reply. Now we are past returning the robot to Amazon and We are stuck with a very expensive, useless robot. I’m still hoping they get back to me, but it has been a month already... very disappointed!!
customer_reviews.author: Melita Baldwin

customer_reviews.title: My nephew loves this - what a great set. I would have loved this when I ...
customer_reviews.text: My nephew loves this - what a great set. I would have loved this when I was a kit! Amazing what it can do right out of the box when paired with a good tablet. We used an iPad Air2 and had it up and going within a few minutes. The registration process with their website is kind of a pain though and could use some modification, but other than their clunky online registration it's a wonderful little robot!
customer_reviews.author: FlyboyyyTop Contributor: Running

customer_reviews.title: Kinda boring, in my opinion
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty fun at first but my son is losing interest after several plays. I'm glad I bought the challenge cards to go with this otherwise we'd really not have much to do with this and get bored even faster. Very neat but not sure I'd spend so much again for something that gets boring quickly.
customer_reviews.author: ZumaLun

customer_reviews.title: Not a good toy for younger kids
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 5 year old. I thought he would grow into and be able to play with some of the simple functions but there aren’t any. It is basically only for older kids. It’s also hard for me to figure out. Yet another thing to mess with that I don’t have time for.
customer_reviews.author: Simone S.

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly few instructions but great with free apps
customer_reviews.text: There is no instruction manual whatsoever, just a bunch of dumb legal warnings about not using it in the bathtub etc. Once you go to the App Store and download the recommended apps, though, it works like a charm. I was actually surprised how much this thing is capable of doing. It's a lot of fun for the kids to program.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Got two of these for my granddaughters for Christmas and ...
customer_reviews.text: Got two of these for my granddaughters for Christmas and they are still playing with them three weeks after.
customer_reviews.author: RoverToad

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic.
customer_reviews.text: I've tried other droids/bots etc - like the hero bb-8 large droid - This little robot blows that droid into a galaxy far, far away... with a doubled sided saber.. So much more "meat" and "substance", personality.. here to dig into. If you want quality, education and fun THIS is the bot for you (r) kid. Doesn't work with Ipad 2 - must be ipad 3 or later - Not sure about iphone versions - Works with our 6s's though.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Chapman

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with Kindle
customer_reviews.text: After using Dash robots at school, my daughter saved for months to buy her own. I researched if the robot would work with our new Kindle & according to the Wonder Works website, it would. One week after using the robot, it quit working. The only solution the company could give me is it was a software glitch from a required update was the problem. I was told give them a couple of weeks for a repair. That was the last email they responded to. Needless to say, my kid is very disappointed. Dont waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for lovers of code writing
customer_reviews.text: Nicely built with quality materials and versatile for use. Coding may get boring and tiresome for shorter attention spans, even given the creative way in which this company approaches keeping kids engaged. My 5 year old gets bored after 20 to 40 min of use but overall he loves it. He needs lots of support/ help to accomplish challenges. He's not tech oriented like other kids but has a large enough attention span. He loves the mischief as you can code the robot to make sounds. I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: McBane

customer_reviews.title: This was a hit!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our six-year-old grandson. It is a big hit. My son worked through the initial programming with him. As he learns to read better on his own he will be able to work on the programming more on his own. He was also happy to just use it as a remote control robot. He loved being able to record his own things for Dash to say. I anticipate this being a popular toy for a long time to come.
customer_reviews.author: cmwriter

customer_reviews.title: Computers are the future teach them young
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 5 year old grandsons birthday. He loves it! He has learned how to program it from his kindle to chase the dog and bark at him. Lol He is moving on to learning new things thank goodness for the dogs sake.
customer_reviews.author: Zuzieq981

customer_reviews.title: My six year old absolutely adores Dash. The app ...
customer_reviews.text: My six year old absolutely adores Dash. The app is very polished and intuitive for him should get a few years out of this product.
customer_reviews.author: DJG

customer_reviews.title: Just Buy It
customer_reviews.text: Complete impulse buy for me, and I couldn’t be happier. Considering all of the crap that we spend our money on, this is great value. Your kids will learn
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: great toy
customer_reviews.text: daughter loves this. found out they use this in schools to learn programming so was a good purchase. the programming is simple but a great way to get started
customer_reviews.author: rw

customer_reviews.title: A really cool toy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 7 yr old. He says it is his favorite Christmas gift. It's a lot of fun and seems like a good quality toy. It moves smoothly across both carpet and hard flooring. He enjoys that it speaks in his voice and has a lot of great features. He was a little disappointed to learn he has to use my iPad to control it instead of his amazon kids tablet, but that isn't a big deal. I like that he is learning when he uses it.
customer_reviews.author: Natedawg

customer_reviews.title: Not very intelligent out of the box. Does it “learn”? Who knows.
customer_reviews.text: Its a robot. Does what you tell it. Record what you say. Other than that, this doesnt seem to learn anything. Is it supposed to? Who knows. There are practically no instructions. No built-in intelligence. Rc with wheels. And you need 2 or more separate apps. This couldve been waaay better. I cant recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Opinion Nobody Asked You To Agree With

customer_reviews.title: This has to be the BEST ROBOT EVER
customer_reviews.text: This has to be the BEST ROBOT EVER! Easy to use, program and simply ADORABLE! I have purchased 5; my students and I are learning so much about programming with them.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline

customer_reviews.title: He's just the most adorable thing ever
customer_reviews.text: He's just the most adorable thing ever. I do love that it helps teach my son how to start programming. Although, he may be a bit too young for this, he is still working on getting the hang of it. He does love the recording options for now.
customer_reviews.author: Nwest

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: I gave My soon to be 10 year old grandson the Dash Robot for Christmas. He is absolutely thrilled with it, can’t hardly stop “playing “ with it. He’s in the talented and gifted group at school where they have been working on robot programming and have used a Dash their teacher brought to school. He’s already gotten our money’s worth in 2 days! I’ll be giving him the launcher and challenge cards pack for his birthday in a few days and anticipate he’ll be totally inseparable from it then :)
customer_reviews.author: Jane Jech

customer_reviews.title: NO INSTRUCTIONS INCLUDED
customer_reviews.text: Why did this very expensive purchase not come with instructions on use? I get that it’s programmable to a iPad but shouldn’t there be instructions to help get started????
customer_reviews.author: wendy winders

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for older kids
customer_reviews.text: It’s a little hard for my 7yr old nephew to get into, but I really enjoyed programming it and teaching him. Can’t wait for him to really get into it
customer_reviews.author: Lulu

customer_reviews.title: Toy for learning , what could go wrong
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my grandkids while we are dealing with covid-19 . So far it’s been fun and educational , seems like a pretty painless way to introduce them to some basic logic . I might buy one more so they can do some interactive programming also .
customer_reviews.author: Stephen E. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Students in grades 3 through 5 love it!
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased two of these so far for my classroom. With the free apps and some additional accessories, students have programmed the robot to move, light up, play music, launch balls, etc. They are having a blast learning how to program these robots.
customer_reviews.author: Petite

customer_reviews.title: Great robot! Also, kids love it
customer_reviews.text: 4 year old can have fun with it. 6 year old is able to make more intense use. The programming/game interface provides learning opportunities for years. Catapult is an instant hit. The xylophone is my least favorite as it's very limiting but even that is cool. If you're on the fence, buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Arturo

customer_reviews.title: Won’t Connect
customer_reviews.text: Won’t stay connected to app on iPhone 7/8/X, fire tablet, or iPad. Tried updating firmware several times, still won’t work. Would connect when plugged in, instantly disappeared from app as a recognized dash. Not an awesome outcome on Christmas morning. Fingers crossed for a successful replacement.
customer_reviews.author: ML

customer_reviews.title: My 8 year old loves this toy. He can ...
customer_reviews.text: My 8 year old loves this toy. He can code and program or just use the controls it's worth the investment . The launcher is also a big hit. My 6 year old loves it too
customer_reviews.author: Jdhill

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: My 7 year old has had a blast playing and learning with dot & dash. It’s amazing the things that they come up with and do with them. We have had them for some time and not one problem they have work with out any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Bentley

customer_reviews.title: Horrible purchase. Regretting it.
customer_reviews.text: Flimsy. The launcher does not work. For Dash, the very first thing is to get it to say “Hello”. We did but now the app says “something is wrong” so we are perpetually stuck. User interface is clumsy and there are way too many apps to just do simple things. Wish there were a single app, and a listed items for kids to self-start.
customer_reviews.author: Nilendu Misra

customer_reviews.title: Durable, easy to learn commands
customer_reviews.text: My 6 year old loves coding with this robot. It is super user friendly. The challenge activities build in difficulty to help learn how to connect code. My children use the same robot in their elementary school, so it is the perfect way to continue learning at home.
customer_reviews.author: TiffanyP

customer_reviews.title: Great robot!
customer_reviews.text: This was a birthday gift for my nephew. He loves it and cant stop playing with it. My sister woke up the other morning to sounds at 5am and he was up, zooming it around the living room. I read the reviews and was a bit skeptical but I gave it a shot and was not disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel

customer_reviews.title: Very fun, eye looks a little like a camera, but otherwise perfect
customer_reviews.text: It is an AMAZING robot, I don’t mean to sound to “the government is spying on us” or anything but it’s eye looks A LOT like a camera, at first I though oh cool it has a camera I can look at it but now I am kinda wondering if this was something someone could hack on to and see you. If it was a camera you could access on app it would be 100% perfect but other than that, it’s sooo amazing it has a long battery doesn’t take too long to charge not loud and is just so much fun!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome and cool robot
customer_reviews.text: A very good robot. They can use a tablet or phones , to control it. Also you can change color of its eyes by the apps. You can record your voice etc. Really neat gift for my son. He is 12 with autism. He thinks its cool.
customer_reviews.author: ChristineBradtke

customer_reviews.title: Great learning toy for 8 year old
customer_reviews.text: Christmas gift to my 8 year old grandson. It was easy for him to use and he loves it. Seems well built. Just remember that you need a bluetooth-enabled cell phone in order to use the robot. Only concern is whether it is sturdy enough to withstand being abused by a typical 8 year old (dropped, thrown in the toy box, stepped on, etc.).
customer_reviews.author: Walt65

customer_reviews.title: Great STEM learning activity for kids thst want more than a toy
customer_reviews.text: My 10 year old daughter loves this. They have it at school as well. It teaches kids about simple coding, keeps their minds active and creative. My daughter is super active and this robot keeps her mind focused on new ways to program it.
customer_reviews.author: Andria, Fort Lauderdale

customer_reviews.title: My granddaughter loves this!
customer_reviews.text: She loves the interactive voice feature, using HER voice.... but *I* need to teach her how to code it.... which means I have to learn first.... WHERE DO I FIND INSTRUCTIONS? I'll learn Python or R if need be.... and then teach her.... I need guidance here!
customer_reviews.author: BetterAllTheTime

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these for my daughters. They absolutely love them and ask to play with them every day. The app is very easy to use, and everything runs very smoothly. They seem like they are built very well and will last years. I'm happy that they are learning basic coding and having fun.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer13

customer_reviews.title: Great for Younger Sibling
customer_reviews.text: My 10 year old was receiving a robot for Christmas so I wanted to find one appropriate for my 7 year old. I was able to buy Dash for $79 and I have no regrets. My daughter has enjoyed learning basic programming and she is enjoying the launching accessory we also bought.
customer_reviews.author: Marion Hern

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you have a new enough tablet or phone! Otherwise super fun!
customer_reviews.text: Kids are enjoying this a lot. Often times they are fighting over who’s turn it is to play with it. Make sure you have the correct phone or tablet to work with it.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Alm

customer_reviews.title: Love Dash!
customer_reviews.text: My oldest son is ADHD and THIS keeps him more focused than ever! He has renamed him and all.
customer_reviews.author: Dannah H.W.

customer_reviews.title: Compatibility, compatibility and compatibility
customer_reviews.text: Works well with iPad/iPhone. There are definite compatibility issues with Android devices. MFG's website has list of Android device compatibility. Check before purchasing
customer_reviews.author: Benutzer

customer_reviews.title: These little guys are so much fun! We bought then for our school to kick-off ...
customer_reviews.text: These little guys are so much fun! We bought then for our school to kick-off our robotics program. Students in elementary and middle school love the sounds they make and enjoy being able to change the colors and movements.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey Wan

customer_reviews.title: Good For 5-8 years old
customer_reviews.text: This is a good robot for kids who are younger. They like using it with the iPad. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Reader

customer_reviews.title: Dauther's Birthday Gift
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my daughter for her Birthday! She loved it but does not play with it often. The accessories are a little challanging to put on.
customer_reviews.author: LeAnn Mullins

customer_reviews.title: Some simple it's not
customer_reviews.text: The potential of this is amazing, however there isn't a single app that allows you to RECORD YOUR MOVES then playback. Come'on, the most basic robots can do this. Remember, these toys are for the parents too!
customer_reviews.author: I'm a real customer

customer_reviews.title: No instructions, not even online
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know how many stars to even give because I have no idea if this is a good toy or not. There are no instructions for how to use it so it looks like all it does is move around a little and make some noises. Again, no instructions and extremely frustrating to try to figure out. I would recommend the cosmo robot. At least that one has instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Spiegel

customer_reviews.title: way too complicated
customer_reviews.text: if i have to read the instructions 3 times and still can not explain it to my kids, it's probably not going to be fun. great idea incorporating math, but please simplify this game. i returned it.
customer_reviews.author: C. Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Beginner coding
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t receive the illustrated instruction guide with the a robot? It’s really cool. My grandson and I are learning together. Thankful for u-tube
customer_reviews.author: DDB

customer_reviews.title: Dash is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: All three of my kids (8, 6 and 3) love this thing!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara T

customer_reviews.title: Quick Start guide was not included.
customer_reviews.text: Upon opening box, the quick start guide was not included, I had to search online and download the guide. Other than that it appears to be okay. Will give to grandson for Xmas, and see how he reacts to the toy.
customer_reviews.author: ezseeker

customer_reviews.title: Dash is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Dash is great! Tons of free apps to play with him! All of my kids 5,7 and 9 enjoy playing with him!
customer_reviews.author: Porter

customer_reviews.title: Non-stop fun for family
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my niece, so I don't have first hand experience, but my sister keeps sending me video and pictures of my almost-8-year old niece playing with this and carrying it around. Seems to be a hit!
customer_reviews.author: Bethany

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with Galaxy Tab A 7.0 - know your model numbers
customer_reviews.text: Not rating Dash as we can't even use it. Was excited to purchase to get kids involved with coding. Amazon notes indicated it was compatible with Galaxy Tab A - does not indicate only certain versions of that tablet. Of course, it is not compatible with ours, which is a Galaxy Tab A 7.0 so either we return Dash or have to add another device to our household. Very disappointed this information was not stated more clearly.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Delivered in obvious packaging
customer_reviews.text: Excited about this gift. But glad it came when my daughter wasn’t home. Almost spoiled Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Katy W.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent toy
customer_reviews.text: We are very happy with our purchase. This is a great way to introduce a child to Computer Science and coding. Will continue to get Wonder for our kids.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Fun for children.
customer_reviews.text: Given as a gift and know only that the child loves it
customer_reviews.author: Priscilla Flanagan

customer_reviews.title: Great educational tool for kids
customer_reviews.text: A great education toy for teaching kids fundamentals of programming. I took it to India and was able to successfully teach rural children on how to program using this.
customer_reviews.author: Vikas Chawla

customer_reviews.title: Dash
customer_reviews.text: We names this little guy as Simba. Nice product and invention, my 6year old started making tricks with this simba and having him occupied.
customer_reviews.author: Ummidi

customer_reviews.title: Oh my gosh does my son love this.
customer_reviews.text: Oh my gosh does my son love this. He spends hours programming it. It came up to me and said "I want Apple, Give me Apple". He uses his iPhone to program. He's in heaven.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Ames

customer_reviews.text: My daughter is 7 while she was in bed it kept talking and it scared her, so we eventually had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Fun was had by all!
customer_reviews.text: A little expensive, but very well received as a cool Christmas present by our "difficult to buy for" twelve year old grandson.
customer_reviews.author: M. Pierce

customer_reviews.title: Robot for your kid
customer_reviews.text: Daughter loves them, she uses Dash at school. Suggest using a tablet for the app, a phone is too small. Should be entertaining for several years, still figuring it all out.
customer_reviews.author: John T. Gray

customer_reviews.title: Developed fault on first day of use.  NO SUPPORT.
customer_reviews.text: My son was so excited to received this robot but the head stopped rotating after 1 hour of use. I have given one star because I have sent 3 emails to support and have never received even an acknowledgment of receipt! The product seems very good but if they cannot support it properly then I would advise AGAINST purchasing it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Learning and fun a great combination
customer_reviews.text: Bought for two grandsons birthdays for them to share and they both love it. It's wonderful watching them learn while having fun.
customer_reviews.author: BooklovinNana

customer_reviews.title: Great toy
customer_reviews.text: This is such a great toy! Kids love it, also it's very easy to install and use. It's fun to interact with, even older kids enjoy it. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: We Love Dot and Dash!
customer_reviews.text: These are great for kids! I was able to purchase this through a donor's choose grant for my classroom. We use Dash more than Dot, but love all of the accessories.
customer_reviews.author: Christina B.

customer_reviews.title: My grandaughter loved it. I give it a four on my ...
customer_reviews.text: My grandaughter loved it. I give it a four on my end because it is out of my realm of setting up. lol But the most important thing is she loved it and had it going before she left the house.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Can't talk to anyone one knowledgeable.
customer_reviews.text: We have had Dash for months and because we can't make him speak and the coding is quite difficult it stays in the box. Bought all the extra things like sling throwing. I spent a lot of money but kids are not interested.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Teaches technology in a very fun way.
customer_reviews.text: My 7 year old grand kids love this even more than I do. I can't think of a better educational toy for any child over 6.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond R. Morin

customer_reviews.title: Remarkable toy for the price
customer_reviews.text: My kids love this. You can program it and or drive it like an rc car. It can get pretty deep in what you can do with it. I am happy to see these stem toys for kids.
customer_reviews.author: GSF Tech

customer_reviews.title: No directions included, not as great as the video ☹️
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed when we opened the box and there were no directions anywhere, just the warranty? We had to look up how to use online and it wasn’t easy. This product could definitely use improvement!
customer_reviews.author: Shopberg

customer_reviews.title: Bricked at 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Dash is a $149 robot . . . that died just under 3 months after purchase. It literally will not charge. Since it is outside the 30-day return window, Amazon will not exchange it.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: This has been much better than we expected
customer_reviews.text: This has been much better than we expected. My 7 year old is actively coding (using blockly) her Dash ('Flash'). We added the Learn To Code Challenge Card Box to this gift and she's working her way through. She has some experience with Hour of Code (online) and Robot Turtle (game), but this lets her code and see the impact real time and on a physical device.
customer_reviews.author: breadnjam

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My 6 y/o grandson loves this and plays with it non-stop.
customer_reviews.author: Chris D.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very fun and educational my boys love it!! They are 3 and 4!!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Robot
customer_reviews.text: This little robot is an awesome way to introduce coding. Not many instructions but my son (8) figured it out by himslef.
customer_reviews.author: TCassidy

customer_reviews.title: easy and fun
customer_reviews.text: My son has 8y old, he was able to setup everything by himself and he is have fun solving the puzzles so far. Not sure if he grasp the concept that is behind regarding the coding part yet but at least he is enjoying.
customer_reviews.author: hugoinfante83

customer_reviews.title: Bought this as a gift for my 10 year old ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my 10 year old niece and she absolutely loves it. It is an endless source of entertainment, and teaches her something in the process. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: DMcKenna

customer_reviews.title: This little robot is fantastic! Its kept my entire family entertained for hours
customer_reviews.text: This little robot is fantastic! Its kept my entire family entertained for hours. Its full all kind of game and challenges for a kid to work through. I loved it so much that I decided to get the companion robot, Dot, for my son as well! I highly recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: AldijanaZ

customer_reviews.title: Unlike
customer_reviews.text: Not a good toy doesn't do much kinda boring an u have to have a smart phone to use the robot i dont like my 4 year old on my phone
customer_reviews.author: Tiffani

customer_reviews.title: its great! Really fun
customer_reviews.text: My son asked for this for his 10th bday. He has a few other robots, he's never used so I was skeptical. He's played with it every day. its great! Really fun.
customer_reviews.author: poggle

customer_reviews.title: Great learning toy.
customer_reviews.text: My grandson loved it. He’s four so his parents are teaching him how to code. Nice gift.
customer_reviews.author: Norma A. Castaneda

customer_reviews.title: Great Robot
customer_reviews.text: My daughter (8 year old) loves this robot. She has yet to master the coding, she is more interested in it as a remote control car that you can make animal sounds with. She is already pressuring me to get her Dot. Good toy extremely easy setup.
customer_reviews.author: Bsavy

product_meta.title: Wonder Workshop Dash – Coding Robot for Kids 6+ – Voice Activated – Navigates Objects – 5 Free Programming STEM Apps – Creating Confident Digital Citizens
product_meta.description: Style:Dash RobotWith Wonder Workshop Dash robot, kids ages 6 and up can create anything they can imagine. Dash is a real robot that responds to voice commands or any of our five free downloadable apps to sing, draw, and move around. It's more than learning to code. Dash lets kids explore loops, events, conditions, and sequences and see how they result in dash’s real-life movements. Wonder Workshop helps kids engage with technology in an open-ended and significant way – it's not just a toy, it's real-world problem solving. Kids will grow in their confidence as digital citizens and architects by seeing their own designs come to life. dash robot comes charged and ready to enjoy straight out of the box and includes two free building brick connectors. Transform Dash into an animal, a delivery truck, and even a catapult using your own LEGO bricks. Dash can grow right along with you with additional attachments from Wonder Workshop, providing even more challenges and fun. Dash can start at any skill level and build from there, so it's perfect for kids ages 6 and up. The grown-ups might find themselves unable to resist the fun of putting Dash through his paces. At Wonder Workshop, we believe that Tech should be an open canvas for exploration and collaboration. We offer a community that’s supportive and challenging, with regular wonder workshops and robot competitions for kids to build their skills and creativity. Dash is perfect for classrooms, families, and friends, letting kids work solo or come together for Group coding projects. Dash provides up to 5 hours of active play and up to 30 days of standby time with a rechargeable lithium-ion battery, and it recharges with the included power adapter or via USB.
feature_bullets: CREATE: Dash arrives charged and ready to go out of the box. Kids can give Dash Robot voice commands and explore loops, events, conditions, and sequences with the five free apps that come with Dash Robot. It’s more than learning to code.
LEARN: Dash robot offers an open-ended learning platform that makes tech knowledge simple and accessible, helping kids grow into confident creative architects.

COLLABORATE: Wonder League is an encouraging and challenging community where kids can share ideas and build confidence. Wonder Workshop’s Robotics Competitions provides opportunities for kids to work together, helping everyone learn and evolve.

GROW: Extend the possibilities even further with Sketch Kit, Building Block Connectors, and more from Wonder Workshop. Playtime- Up to 5 hours. Standby Time- Up to 30 days. Charging- via Micro USB. Connectivity-Bluetooth Smart 4 / LE
SCHOOLS: Dash is used in over 20, 000 schools today and expanding rapidly.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
